intro: Loncomelos sanandajense, commonly known as the Sanandaj sandmat, is a rare flowering plant native to the Iranian province of Kermanshah. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
